articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Poppy Mcpherson
articles.description: Thousands of Rohingya insurgents have emerged from refugee camps in Bangladesh’s Cox's Bazar, where militant recruitment and violence have surged this year, according to people familiar with the conflict and internal aid agency reports seen by Reuters.
articles.title: In world's largest refugee camps, Rohingya mobilise to fight in Myanmar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah fired heavy rocket barrages at Israel on Sunday, with Israeli media reporting that a building had been hit near Tel Aviv, after a powerful Israeli airstrike killed at least 20 people in Beirut the day before.
articles.title: Hezbollah rocket hits near Tel Aviv after Beirut airstrike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry on Monday reported that a Chinese balloon had been detected over the sea to Taiwan's north, the first time since April it has reported such an incident in what Taipei views as part of a pattern of harassment by Beijing.
articles.title: Taiwan reports Chinese balloon, first time in six months

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli man who went missing in the United Arab Emirates has been found murdered, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Sunday, denouncing his death as a "heinous antisemitic terrorist act".
articles.title: Israel denounces murder of Israeli in UAE after body found

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Voters in South America's laid-back Uruguay, known for its beaches, legalized marijuana and stability, will head to the polls on Sunday in a second-round presidential race between moderates that closes out a bumper year of elections.
articles.title: Uruguay votes for next president in closely fought runoff race

articles.author: Luiza Ilie
articles.description: Center-right leader Elena Lasconi was in second place although nearly tied with two hard-right opponents, exit polls showed.
articles.title: Romanian PM Ciolacu ahead in first round of presidential vote

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military issued new evacuation orders to residents in areas of an eastern Gaza City suburb, setting off a new wave of displacement on Sunday, and a Gaza hospital director was injured in an Israeli drone attack, Palestinian medics said.
articles.title: Israeli army orders Gaza City suburb evacuated, spurring new displacement wave

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Uruguay's new president-elect Yamandu Orsi, whose political ambitions were galvanized by his experience growing up in a dictatorship, was the pollsters' narrow favorite to win the second round of the South American nation's presidential election on Sunday for the center-left.
articles.title: Who is Yamandu Orsi, Uruguay's new 'modern left' president?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Danes, two Australians, a Briton and an American died from methanol poisoning after visiting Vang Vieng, an idyllic town that is popular with foreign backpackers.
articles.title: New Zealand citizen poisoned by tainted alcohol in Laos returns home

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday social media firms would be required to destroy personal data used to verify ages of users, as part of what the government says is a world-leading ban on under-16s using the services.
articles.title: Australia PM plays down privacy fears of social media ban for children
